name: UIAlertView
desc: In apps that run in versions of iOS prior to iOS 8, use the UIAlertView class to display an alert message to the user. An alert view functions similar to but differs in appearance from an action sheet (an instance of UIActionSheet).

items.name: init(title: String, message: String, delegate: UIAlertViewDelegate?, cancelButtonTitle: String?, otherButtonTitles: String, String...)
init(title: String?, message: String?, delegate: Any?, cancelButtonTitle: String?)
items.desc: Convenience method for initializing an alert view.

items.name: var delegate: AnyObject?
items.desc: The receiver’s delegate or nil if it doesn’t have a delegate.

items.name: var alertViewStyle: UIAlertViewStyle
items.desc: The kind of alert displayed to the user.

items.name: var title: String
items.desc: The string that appears in the receiver’s title bar.

items.name: var message: String?
items.desc: Descriptive text that provides more details than the title.

items.name: var isVisible: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is displayed.

items.name: func addButton(withTitle: String?) -> Int
items.desc: Adds a button to the receiver with the given title.

items.name: var numberOfButtons: Int
items.desc: The number of buttons on the alert view.

items.name: func buttonTitle(at: Int) -> String?
items.desc: Returns the title of the button at the given index.

items.name: func textField(at: Int) -> UITextField?
items.desc: Returns the text field at the given index

items.name: var cancelButtonIndex: Int
items.desc: The index number of the cancel button.

items.desc: The index of the first other button.

items.desc: Dismisses the receiver, optionally with animation.

items.desc: The presentation style of the alert.
